meanings.definition: To make something the theme or central topic.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys thematising her stories to make them more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is thematising the importance of teamwork in class discussions.
meanings.sent3: The children were thematising their playtime around the idea of superheroes.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork thematises the beauty of nature in a captivating way.
meanings.sent5: By thematising her presentation on space, she captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The act of identifying or focusing on a particular theme or topic.
meanings.sent1: The thematising of the novel's main idea helped the students understand it better.
meanings.sent2: His thematising of the project's key points made the presentation clear.
meanings.sent3: The thematising of the party was centered around a tropical theme.
meanings.sent4: The thematising of the museum exhibit highlighted the artist's unique style.
meanings.sent5: Her thematising of the event made it memorable for all attendees.
